page.title: 10DUFTON YOUTH HOSTEL
page.content: The Hostel is situated on the village green.The number of visitor nights last year (1984) was 6018 & the average length of stay was 1.5 days. About 25% of visitors are walking the Pennine Way long distance footpath which passes through the village.25% walk in the area generally & about 40% are children or students who come for fieldwork with their teachers.The remaining 10% come for the cross- country skiing courses in the winter. These are inclusive package holidays for beginners,although cross-country skis can be hired daily.Skiers come mostly from Manchester,Newcastle and Teesside & some from London.Other visitors come from all over the country.About 50 each year come from Europe & 20 from the U.S.A.The present Warden has been at the Hostel about a year.
